Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup with handle root; interior glazed black; exterior: at far left, black handle surround; incised palmette with added red on heart; black-figure decoration consisting of horseman to right (trace of black leg and foot with added white), riding white horse (hindquarters, part of body and upper off-foreleg remaining; white partly effaced with black showing through); below horse's belly tail of another horse, to right.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.593.a.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.28)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0532) (Phase 1)
